description: Unique identifier for the work order used across maintenance, scheduling, and billing.
Name of the workgroup or shop responsible for the order.
User or technician currently assigned to perform the work.
Identifier for the assigned technician/team member; likely a personnel ID; confirm with SME.
Date and time the work order was officially issued or opened.
Planned target completion date/time for the work.
Date and time the order was closed/completed in the system.
Current lifecycle status code of the work order (e.g., open, in progress, closed).
Code indicating the type of work (e.g., preventive maintenance, repair, inspection).
Short description of the problem or work requested as captured at creation.
Accounting or cost center number to which expenses are charged.
Project identifier the work is associated with for tracking and billing.
Business priority level determining scheduling urgency.
Textual workflow state used by dispatch/scheduling to indicate progress.
Supervisor responsible for overseeing this work.
Crew lead or foreman in charge of on-site work.
Record classification code for the entry (e.g., work order vs. other record types).
Code describing how the request originated (e.g., call-in, inspection, telematics); confirm mappings with SME.
Identifier of the internal or external customer requesting service.
Indicator for maintenance class, typically Corrective (CM) versus Preventive (PM).
Planner or scheduler who prepared the work plan.
User who approved the work order or plan.
Reference to a related system or financial transaction; confirm linkage with SME.
Stored map annotations or GIS markup relevant to the job location.
Estimated labor hours required to complete the job.
Estimated labor cost for the job.
Estimated internal equipment usage cost.
Estimated parts/materials cost.
Estimated contractor/subcontractor cost.
Estimated miscellaneous costs not covered by other estimates.
Requester’s mobile phone number.
Alternate phone number for the requester.
Requester’s email address.
Free-text details provided by the requester about the issue.
Requester address street number.
Requester address street name.
Nearest cross street to the requester’s address.
Requester address city.
Requester address state/province.
Requester address postal/ZIP code.
Narrative description of the work site location.
Short title or summary of the initial service request.
Additional comments supplied with the service request.
Internal notes captured during request intake.
Flag indicating the work site should use the customer’s stored address.
Key referencing the requester’s saved address record.
Work site address street number.
Work site address street name.
Nearest cross street for the work site.
Work site city.
Work site state/province.
Work site postal/ZIP code.
Latitude coordinate of the work site or asset.
Longitude coordinate of the work site or asset.
Altitude/elevation of the work site, if available.
Indicator whether the work location is on private property.
Key referencing the stored work site address record.
Linked CRM service request number.
Identifier of the related CRM entity (e.g., account, asset, case).
Name of the related CRM entity.
Type of CRM contact interaction (e.g., phone, email).
CRM user or agent who handled the contact.
Timestamp when the CRM contact occurred.
Timestamp recorded by CRM system for the interaction.
User-defined fields header/template identifier; likely links to a UDF configuration. Confirm with SME.

Configurable numeric field for business-specific metrics.

User who created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User who last updated the record.
Timestamp of the most recent update.
Narrative of work performed or corrective actions completed.
Supervisor’s internal notes regarding the order.
Scheduling reference or schedule number for planned work.
Total estimated cost (sum of labor, parts, equipment, contractors, misc.).
Estimated quantity of units or tasks to complete.
Identifier linking to attached documents, images, or files.
Identifier of the master work order governing this job.
Actual start date and time of work.
Actual finish/complete date and time.
Department that submitted the request.
Identifier for the operator/operation associated with the job; confirm with SME.
Reference to a standardized issue or problem code.
Identifier of the portal submission or account that logged the request.
Flag indicating whether the request is visible publicly.
Indicator that work was delayed due to insufficient expertise.
Indicator that work was delayed due to insufficient time availability.
Indicator that work was delayed due to lack of power/utilities.
Indicator that work was delayed due to unavailable tools/equipment.
Indicator that work was delayed due to missing information.
Indicator that work was delayed due to unavailable parts.
Complaint or completion remarks related to the order; meaning may vary. Confirm with SME.
General comments or notes recorded against the work order.
Linked work request number from the intake system.
Reason code or description for asset downtime.
Planned start date/time.
Planned finish/complete date/time.
Date the service request was submitted.
Flag indicating if costs are billable to a customer.
Company name of the requester or customer.
Meter reading before service (e.g., odometer or engine hours).
Meter reading after service.
Vehicle Identification Number of the asset.
License plate or registration number.
Manufacturer model number.
Engine power rating in horsepower.
Manufacturer’s serial or production number.
Model year of the asset.
Manufacturer brand.
Primary fuel type used by the asset.
Indicator that the asset has autonomous/driver-assist capability; confirm with SME.
Geospatial geometry of the location/asset (e.g., GIS point/shape).
Sequence number for this stop in a route.
Management unit code grouping assets, crews, or budgets.
Activity/job code for work classification and reporting.
Driver associated to the asset at the time of the issue/work.
Identifier of the immediate parent work order in a hierarchy.
Mobile client/user identifier associated with this record.
Identifier of the mobile device used to process the order.
Mobile operating platform (e.g., iOS, Android) used.
Flag indicating the record was deleted on a mobile device.
Customer name linked to the order.
Classification of customer (e.g., internal, external).
Reason code for denying the associated work request.
Free-text explanation for the denial decision.
Requester address second line (suite, unit, etc.).
Work site address second line (suite, yard, etc.).
First name of the mobile user/contact linked to the order.
Last name of the mobile user/contact linked to the order.
External customer identifier provided with the request.
System-generated unique key for the work order record.
Identifier used by the mobile app to reference the work order.
Indicator that labor, equipment, and materials are shared across related orders; confirm with SME.

Code for the shop, depot, or location responsible for the work.
Geometric location derived from geocoding the address.
Source of site location data (e.g., GPS, manual entry, CRM).
Primary work request number when multiple requests are linked.
Identifier referencing a GIS geometry object.
Flag indicating derived fields (e.g., costs, routes) need recalculation.
Responsible department identifier.
Sub-location identifier within a facility or yard.
Geographic or organizational district code.
Indicator that formal approval is required before proceeding.
Site-specific user-defined field.
